Cipla promoters on today's stake sale

Dr Y K Hamied, Chairman and Mr MK Hamied, Vice Chairman who are Non-Executive Directors and promoters, have sold 2,01,69,756 shares (representing 2.5% of the total issued and paid-up share capital of the Company) today.


Post this transaction, the promoter group will continue to hold 34.23% in the company. The group remains fully committed and invested in the future of Cipla Limited.


The senior promoters who are both in their eighties, intend to use the funds generated from this sale for personal purposes including philanthropy. The promoter group does not plan to sell any further shares in the foreseeable future

Read carefully 
I have explained current market situation in detail which can help you in taking further actions

For now guys i will say :

1 - there are few tensions in market like 
(Fed interest rate hike, ukraine war tension) so these tensions are temporary which do not come easily so benifit from these and pick good fundamental companies for investing.

2 - market can take 2-4 months to price in these situation and then move upwards. 

3- its better to pick good fundamental companies from midcap and smallcap to have higher return.

4- if someone wants to invest in bitcoin or any other cryptocurrency then you cam invest 30-50% of amount in next 2-3 weeks and rest 50% you can add if it comes near 20k level

5- At this point , market is throwing those people out of market which have  just come in last 2 years and does not have long term view or enough knowledge and patience to stay patient so dont do much stupidity at this point.
This is the way which market usually do when alot of new investors come by seeing gains.

6- No doubt market was too much overvalued so this is the correction time going on and for me it is accumulation time. 
Crash ka koi scene ni hai unless and until something big happens.
And agr log prepared hai just like this time then crash never happens so chill and make a portfolio which is going to give returns in 3rd and 4th quarter. 
Hope so ü§û

7- And yeah market will be volatile in coming 2-3  months as we are seeing news of russia- ukraine war and fed interest rate hike news

8- jha tk war ke bare mein
We can just take a guess that its not going to happen as countries are not capable of fighting any war at this time because covid has already paralyzed economies, so no one can afford it.

1. No SWIFT access doesn't mean no commodity trade payments

3. No SWIFT would slow payments & rise in account receivables for exporters

FED RAISED RATE BY 25 BASIS POINTS

U.S. Federal Reserve hikes key interest rates for the first time since 2018.

FED: INFLATION IS STILL HIGH, OWING TO SUPPLY AND DEMAND MISMATCHES CAUSED BY THE PANDEMIC, RISING ENERGY PRICES, AND BROADER PRICING PRESSURES.

Fed Sees 6 More Rate Hike This Year

FED'S POWELL: FOMC EXPECTS TO REDUCE SIZE OF BALANCE SHEET

FED'S POWELL: INFLATION REMAINS SUBSTANTIALLY ABOVE TARGET.

FED'S POWELL: SUPPLY DISRUPTIONS  ARE LARGER AND ARE LASTING LONGER THAN EXPECTED.

FED'S POWELL: IT WILL TAKE LONGER THAN EXPECTED FOR INFLATION TO RETURN TO TARGET.

FED'S POWELL: THE LIKELIHOOD OF A RECESSION ISN'T EXTREMELY HIGH.

FED'S POWELL: THE ECONOMY IS 'WELL POSITIONED' TO DEAL WITH INTEREST RATE HIKES.

FED'S POWELL: I ANTICIPATE THAT INFLATION WILL REMAIN HIGH UNTIL THE MIDDLE OF THE YEAR.

FED'S POWELL: THE COMMITTEE RECOGNISES THAT THE TIME FOR RAISING INTEREST RATES AND REDUCING THE BALANCE SHEET HAS ARRIVED.

FED'S POWELL: MONETARY POLICY IS STARTING TO WEIGH ON INFLATION AND GROWTH WITH A LAG; WE'LL SEE MORE OF IT IN 2023 AND 2024.

FED'S POWELL: WE'LL BE WATCHING FOR INFLATION DATA AS IT COMES IN.

FED'S POWELL: IF INFLATION INDICATORS INDICATE THAT RATES SHOULD BE RAISED MORE SWIFTLY, THE FED WILL DO SO.

FED'S POWELL: WE HAVE A PLAN TO GRADUALLY RAISE INTEREST RATES OVER THE COURSE OF THE YEAR.

How inflation comes and how it can be controlled!! üëá


Inflation is caused by the failure of aggregate supply to equal the increase in aggregate demand. Inflation can, therefore, be controlled by increasing the supplies of goods and services and reducing money incomes in order to control aggregate demand.

#inflation

¬†There are a variety of tools to control inflation including:

Monetary policy¬†‚Äì Higher interest rates reduce demand in the economy, leading to lower economic growth and lower inflation.

Control of money supply¬†‚Äì Monetarists argue there is a close link between the money supply and inflation, therefore controlling money supply can control inflation.

Supply-side policies¬†‚Äì policies to increase the competitiveness and efficiency of the economy, putting downward pressure on long-term costs.

Fiscal policy¬†‚Äì a higher rate of income tax could reduce spending, demand and inflationary pressures.

Wage controls ‚Äì¬†trying to control wages could, in theory, help to reduce inflationary pressures. However, apart from the 1970s, it has been rarely used.

In Simple words(HOW TO CONTROL INFLATION)

PRINTING LESS MONEY
INCREASING INTEREST RATE
INCREASING SUPPLY OF PRODUCTS

A windfall tax is a surtax imposed by governments on businesses or economic sectors that have benefited from economic expansion. The purpose is to redistribute excess profits in one area for the greater social good; however, this can be a contentious idea

The government has levied a windfall tax on profits of oil and gas companies with crude surging over 50 percent in 2022 so far. The government has imposed a Rs 6 per litre tax on the export of petrol and ATF and Rs 13 per litre tax on the export of diesel, the finance ministry notifications said
